root.name: curve()
root.description: Draws a curved line on the screen. The first and second parameters specify the first anchor point and the last two parameters specify the second anchor. The middle parameters specify the points for defining the shape of the curve. Longer curves can be created by putting a series of curve() functions together. The curve() function is an implementation of Catmull-Rom splines.
root.syntax: curve(x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3, x4, y4);

parameter.label: x1, y1
parameter.description: int: coordinates for the first anchor

parameter.label: x2, y2
parameter.description: int: coordinates for the first point

parameter.label: x3, y3
parameter.description: int: coordinates for the second point

parameter.label: x4, y4
parameter.description: int: coordinates for the second anchor
